conclusion: Xiao Ming is on the beach at point A and needs to reach Xiao Zhang in the water at point B.
Xiao Ming runs on the beach with a speed v1 and swims in the water with a slower speed v2 (v1 > v2).
Route 3 is the optimal path that minimizes the total travel time, involving running on the beach at angle θ1 and swimming in the water at angle θ2.
The total time T for Xiao Ming to travel along route 3 is the sum of the time spent running on the beach and swimming in the water.
Running time T_beach is calculated as distance on the beach divided by running speed, T_beach = d_beach / v1.
Swimming time T_water is calculated as distance in the water divided by swimming speed, T_water = d_water / v2.
The principle of least time implies that angles θ1 and θ2 are related by Snell's Law: sin θ1 / v1 = sin θ2 / v2.
Rearranging Snell's Law gives the ratio v1 / v2 = sin θ1 / sin θ2.
The final answer for the ratio v1 / v2 is equal to the ratio of the sines of the angles: v1 / v2 = sin θ1 / sin θ2.
